remarks: Derive a disjunction over a Cartesian product from the disjunctions over its first and second elements.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 9-Mar-2018.)
statement:
disjxpin.1 $e |- ( x = ( 1st ` p ) -> C = E ) $.
disjxpin.2 $e |- ( y = ( 2nd ` p ) -> D = F ) $.
disjxpin.3 $e |- ( ph -> Disj_ x e. A C ) $.
disjxpin.4 $e |- ( ph -> Disj_ y e. B D ) $.
disjxpin $p |- ( ph -> Disj_ p e. ( A X. B ) ( E i^i F ) ) $.
$d A p x $.
$d B p y $.
$d C p $.
$d D p $.
$d E x $.
$d F y $.
